prerequisites: Prerequisite: Psychology 110 or instructor permission. Psychology 256 or 258 recommended
summary: This seminar introduces students to major psychological theories and research on the development, perpetuation and reduction of prejudice. A social and historical approach to race, culture, ethnicity and race relations will provide a backdrop for examining psychological theory and research on prejudice formation and reduction. Major areas to be discussed are cognitive social learning, group conflict and contact hypothesis.
title: Psychology of Prejudice
